div.p: We arrived here safely last Saturday, the morning after we left Memphis. Found all well at Aunt Coffees, They were all very glad to see us. We are enjoying ourselves very much. Sister R talks some of staying all the summer, she is so much pleased with her misit, and as for me, I am much better than when I left Memphis, indded I feel almost well and myself again. I ought to have written to you before. We are very anxious to hear how your health is, and that you have entirely recovered; also anxious to hear what news brother John brings from your place. I hope he brings favorable news. Write to me on receipt of this. Please send

my letters to here until Sunday night, after that Keep them in Memphis until you hear from me. I shall leave here Monday or Tuesday, but know not yet whether I shall go by Nashville or not. I will write you again as too that.
Daniel is well and enjoying the country very much; he and Andrew Hutchins are constantly on the go.
How is Mr. Bedford, I truly hope he is better.
Sister K. Daniel, Aunt Coffer and all her family join me in much love for you, ma, cousin Kate, John and all at home.
